div.p: ‘In the temple of Berenice Aktia. I, Dionysius son of Athenagoras, known on the active list as Nicholas son of Onesimus, of Olus, first-friend and sabre-bearer, to Heracleides son of Apollonius, Macedonian; I swear the royal oath that I have assigned to you the two silver drachmae issued to me every month from the royal treasury towards the interest on the sums borrowed on a note of loan and a bank order payable through Hermias’ bank for 400 silver drachmae and I will take no action against ….’
